reviewerName: Ash "Im a Michigan native who loves reading ...
reviewText: In the vast sandy wasteland known as the great Kanto desert the remnants of humanity struggle to survive. The meager lives of these desert dwellers are further complicated by the constant threat of debt collectors, bandits and outlaw gangs. For help the people of the Kanto desert turn to the legendary Desert Punk and the other mercenaries of the Handyman guild.The series follows the exploits of Desert Punk a snarky mercenary whose sharp wit and questionable methods ensure he will be one of the deserts most successful mercenaries complicating both his professional and personal life is his obsession with women.Being an older show the animation doesn’t meet today’s standards, but that’s not to say its bad. As for the characters, story and English dub they’re great.Be warned this series contains very suggestive themes so it may not be suitable for children!

reviewText: Ratings are a guesstimate, usually on the "safe side".Sub-genre: Post-apocalyptic sci-fi/comedySituations: Probably RLanguage: Probably RNudity:  PG  (but there are groping scenes, clothed, hence the R in situations)Violence: PG  Lots, but nobody ever seems to die and limited blood/not gory.Disc/Formatting:Language options: Dub, Sub with separate on/off option. The way it should be.The usual unforgivable offense: the ads that play on load can't be skipped or bypassed. (Like I need to see ads for stuff I own or will want to watch the same ads every time I watch this DVD for years to come...)If you can't find disc 1 it's because it's behind the ad flyers on the front cover...Special Features:LOTS! And a lot of them are really pretty good (for a change). Common to each or most disks: Desert Parody - Old movie posters re-drawn to the series. 2 per disk, some are very good. Original Japanese extras - some of these are also worth checking out, even if you don't usually like subtitled extras. Life in the Desert - Character Bios (something I generally like). Textless songs, Trailers [Rant time: Desert Punk trailer... aren't I watching it, so why advertise it to me?, Degrassi!, a live action US sit-com (Again!), ads for online and non-online stores... I can't even begin to describe how cheap and cheesy this looks. For the rest, if you are going to waste a minute or so of disc space, at LEAST tell me what it''s about! A basic plot premise, some info on the genre, SOMETHING! So I rate about 90% of the ones I veiwed as wastes of space.] Occasional or single extras include a couple of "As seen on TV" that are dubbed but edited as they were for Japanese TV, an episode (6) of Mr. Stain on Junk Alley, interviews, cast auditions (audio only, no video) and my personal favorite on Disc 6: Bloopers!Brief synopsis:It is 200-300 years after the fall of an advanced (Human) civilization and much of the world seems to be desert. The Great Kanto Plains are now the Great Kanto Desert, a place where life is hard and harsh, water is scarce, and life is cheap. Desert Punk, aka The Demon of the Desert is a Handyman, a person who'll take on almost any job, but most often hire out as mercenaries. He uses a handful of ingenious tricks to fight his battles, evening the odds when outnumbered. He is motivated solely by two things, money and large breasts. His pursuit of both often wind up leading him into more trouble that he can handle, especially when Junko, a babe with G+ sized breats and a penchant as a con-artist is involved. He picks up an apprentice, unwillingly at first, after defeating the sniper she served while he was trying to kill Desert Punk for the boost to his reputation. As the series progresses it takes on a more serious plot (but remains a comedy) as more is learned about the governments. The Kanto desert is ruled by four "Oasis" (North, South, East, and West). They rule by technological superiority using recovered tech from the "Dark Ages" (pre-apocalypse). As is predictable, Desert Punk can't avoid getting drawn into trouble and trouble with the government is almost inevitable. I'll leave it there to prevent spoiling the ending which is so expectable it comes as an unexpected surprise.Overall I'd say this is a "keeper". It's one of the more interesting and thoughtful stories I've seen in a while. Despite being occasionally "ecchi" there's a lot of character development and thought behind the character's motives. I'd have to say it's worth buying to anyone who likes anime.

reviewText: In the great Kanto desert is a place of danger and extreme beautiful all rolled up into one scene. The self proclaimed Desert Punk aka Kanta Mizuno is the closest thing you'll get to a good guy out there.  His way aren't always honorable but he out to make a name for himself as the best handyman for the job. But handy he's not.  Only if he can keep his mind out of every pair of boobs he's see and keep his mind on the job at hand. Just remember when hiring the desert Punk is job as good as done. Just don't send and big boobs girls his way and everything will be alright. In the end he will go down as the desert greatest handyman ever. reviewText: This is one of the most fun shows I have ever watched. It is dirty, misogynistic ( I spelled that correctly on the first try, YEA!), and just a lot of fun. It is not a happy story. It is not a deep story. It is a train wreck. It is the story of a perverted, poor, selfish, materialistic mercenary in a mad-max like post-apocalyptic world. Can he survive his enemies? Can he cut a deal to feel up his rival's boobs? Can he complete a job without alienating his clients? Will his greed and lust end the world a second time? Watch and find out. Laugh while doing so.
summary: Satire, spoof, or just plain wrong - you decide.

reviewText: A mix of brains, guns, and crazy. You've got the punk who is the craftiness greediest and craziest guy in the desert.  He can think his way into or out of any situation with a savagery on par with an animal. The only thing that can get in his way is a woman with a massive rack with the brains to use it. but other than that he's unstoppable when mad.
